story.title: Your Moroccan Adventure Awaits
story.paragraph1: Morocco Atlas Adventure is your gateway to the heart of Morocco's vibrant landscapes, timeless culture, and legendary hospitality. Specializing in guided tours across Tangier, Fes, Marrakech, and Casablanca, we craft immersive travel experiences that reveal the authentic spirit of Morocco.
story.paragraph2: Our curated itineraries offer flexibility to suit every explorer, with options including 2-day, 3-day, 7-day, 10-day, and 15 day tours. Discover bustling medinas, imperial architecture, and the lively pulse of Moroccan cities.
story.paragraph3: For adventure seekers, we offer unforgettable trekking experiences in the breathtaking Atlas Mountains, including legendary peaks like Toubkal—the highest in North Africa.

hero.title: 2 Days Trek in Oukaimden To Imlil Valley
hero.subtitle: A breathtaking journey through valleys, villages, and mountain trails

journey.title: An Unforgettable Trek from Oukaimden to Imlil Valley
journey.description1: Embark on a two-day trek from Oukaimden to Imlil Valley and discover the heart of Morocco’s High Atlas Mountains. Walk through breathtaking landscapes, traditional Berber villages, and scenic mountain passes, while experiencing authentic Moroccan mountain life far from the city bustle.
journey.description2: This gentle adventure combines nature, culture, and discovery. From the snowy peaks of Oukaimden to the lush valleys of Imlil, enjoy panoramic views, local hospitality, and delicious homemade meals — a true Berber experience in just two unforgettable days.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Marrakech → Oukaimeden → Tacheddirt (2300m)
timeline.description: Meet your mountain guide, drive to Oukaimeden and start hiking up to Tizi N'Addi. Meet Berber families on the way, enjoy incredible views before descending to Tacheddirt village. Overnight in local guesthouse.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Tacheddirt → Tizi N'Tamatert (2280m) → Imlil (1740m)
timeline.description: Breakfast then descent through Berber villages. Enjoy mint tea with locals before climbing to Tizi N'Tamatert pass. Lunch with views over Toubkal mountains. End the trek in Imlil and return to Marrakech.

includedItems: Transfers between Marrakech and the trek’s start and end points
1 Night in homestay during the hike.
The services of muleteers, and their mules.
My services as a certified mountain guide

hero.title: 3 Days Trek in Berber Villages
hero.subtitle: Discover the culture and landscapes of the Atlas Mountains

journey.title: Explore the Heart of Berber Culture in the Atlas Mountains
journey.description1: Discover the magnificent Atlas Mountains, enjoy the beauty of the valleys, and explore authentic Berber villages. Walk through natural landscapes while experiencing the lifestyle and traditions of the local communities.
journey.description2: This trek offers unforgettable human encounters, traditional food, peaceful mountain trails, and breathtaking views — a truly immersive cultural experience in just 3 days.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Marrakech → Tizi Ouddid (2000m) → Tizi Oussem (1800m) → Azib Tamsoult Refuge (2250m)
timeline.description: Pick up from Marrakech and drive to Aguersoual. Meet the local team and start hiking to Tizi Ouddid pass with superb views over Azzaden and Imlil valleys. Continue through Id Aissa village before reaching Tizi Oussem. Overnight in a peaceful guest house.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Azib Tamsoult (2250m) → Tizi n’Tzikert Pass (2930m) → Aremd Village (1900m)
timeline.description: Walk uphill through forest toward Tizi n’Tzikert Pass with views over the colorful mountains and Mount Toubkal. Descend toward Aremd Village. Overnight in a lodge with traditional hospitality.

timeline.title: Day 3 — Aremd Village (1900m) → Imlil (1740m) → Marrakech
timeline.description: Breakfast then walk down to Imlil where your driver meets you for the transfer back to Marrakech. A wonderful experience full of memories from the High Atlas!

includedItems: 2 Nights in homestay during the hike
Services of muleteers and their mules

hero.title: 7 Days Trek in Toubkal
hero.subtitle: Explore the Atlas Mountains and Berber Villages

journey.title: Discover the High Atlas and Berber Traditions
journey.description1: Embark on a 7-day trek through the High Atlas Mountains, exploring beautiful valleys, Berber villages, and traditional culture. Each day offers a mix of challenging hikes and opportunities to immerse in local life.
journey.description2: Experience stunning panoramas, mountain trails, and unforgettable moments from the summit of Jebel Toubkal to peaceful riversides. Relax in village cafés and enjoy mint tea after your daily adventures.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Marrakech → Tassa Ouirgane → Tiziane (1800m)
timeline.description: Drive to Tassa Ouirgane and start trekking toward Tiziane. Walk through juniper and cedar forests and along the red-soil valley of Azzadene. Enjoy scenic mountain views and small remote villages.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Tiziane → Tizi 'n Touati → Tizgui (2300m)
timeline.description: Climb out of Azzadene valley to Tizi 'n Touati pass for magnificent views of the High Atlas. Descend through oak forests and villages. Overnight camp near Tizgui at Azib Assoul.

timeline.title: Day 3 — Tizgui → Tizi Oussem (1900m)
timeline.description: Cross Tizi 'n Tagoudalte pass (2700m) and descend through alpine meadows and riverside terraces to the village of Tizi Oussem. Afternoon free to relax or explore the village. Overnight in a gîte.

timeline.title: Day 4 — Tizi Oussem → Aremd (1900m)
timeline.description: Hike to Azib Tamsoulte waterfall, return via Tizi 'n Mzik pass (2500m), and reach the main Toubkal valley at Aremd. Overnight in a village gîte.

timeline.title: Day 5 — Aremd → Refuge du Toubkal (3200m)
timeline.description: Gradually climb through Toubkal valley via Sidi Chamarouch pilgrimage site to the Toubkal refuge. Camp at the foot of Mount Toubkal.

timeline.title: Day 6 — Summit of Toubkal (4167m) → Refuge → Imili
timeline.description: Early morning ascent to the summit (2-3h) for breathtaking views. Descend back to the base camp and follow the Mizane river trail to Imili. Overnight in village or lodge.

timeline.title: Day 7 — Return to Marrakech
timeline.description: Breakfast then transfer from Imili back to Marrakech. End of trek with memories from the High Atlas.

notIncludedItems: Soft drinks and other unspecified beverages
includedItems: Full board during the trek including water, coffee, and tea
Mess, kitchen, and sanitary tents if camping

hero.title: 2 Days Trekking from Chefchaouen to Akchour
hero.subtitle: Explore the Rif Mountains and Scenic Villages

journey.title: Discover the Rif Mountains and Local Culture
journey.description1: Embark on a 2-day trek through the scenic Rif Mountains, hiking from Chefchaouen to Akchour. Enjoy forests, rivers, rock formations, and traditional villages along the way.
journey.description2: Stay overnight at a local guesthouse, immerse yourself in Moroccan culture, and witness stunning natural landscapes from riversides to panoramic mountain viewpoints.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Chefchaouen → Tissouka → Afeska
timeline.description: Pick up from your hotel in Chefchaouen and start walking through the Medina, Place Outa el Hammam, Cemetery, Kasbah Museum, and Grand Mosque. Reach Ras El Ma (Km 0), continue via Bouzafer Mosque and Talassemtane National Park. Arrive in Azilane and overnight at Afeska rural house.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Afeska → God's Bridge → Akchour
timeline.description: Visit the Cascades of Akchour and explore God's Bridge Canyon with scenic stops. Continue to Akchour village for lunch or mint tea by the river. Return to Chefchaouen via Route d’Alchour.

notIncludedItems: Soft drinks and other unspecified beverages
includedItems: Overnight accommodation at Afeska rural house
All transfers and pick-up from Chefchaouen hotel

hero.title: 2 Days Trekking in Merzouga Desert
hero.subtitle: Walk through the dunes of Erg-Chebbi and meet Berber families

journey.title: Explore Erg-Chebbi and the Nomadic Life
journey.description1: A 2-day desert trek from Merzouga to experience the beauty of the Sahara. Walk through golden dunes, enjoy the tranquility, and connect with Berber families.
journey.description2: Spend a peaceful night under the stars at a traditional desert camp, savor Moroccan cuisine, and enjoy local music.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Merzouga → Erg-Chebbi Dunes → Desert Camp
timeline.description: Begin the trek from Merzouga, walking across the soft dunes of Erg-Chebbi. Visit local Berber families, enjoy sunset views, and spend the night in a nomadic-style camp under the stars.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Desert Camp → Black Desert → Return to Merzouga
timeline.description: Watch the sunrise over the dunes, then hike through the Black Desert with volcanic stone fields. After lunch, return to Merzouga by camel or on foot.

hero.title: 3 Days Trekking in the Merzouga Desert
hero.subtitle: Discover Erg-Chebbi, Black Desert, and Berber Villages

journey.title: Hike through Erg-Chebbi and the Black Desert
journey.description1: A 3-day Sahara trekking adventure to dive deeper into the desert. Walk across dunes, visit Berber villages, and explore volcanic plains.
journey.description2: Sleep under the stars, enjoy authentic meals, and connect with nomadic families along the way.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Merzouga → Erg-Chebbi Dunes → Desert Camp
timeline.description: Depart on foot across the majestic Erg-Chebbi dunes. Enjoy desert silence, meet nomadic families, and settle in your desert camp for dinner and stargazing.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Desert Camp → Black Desert → Berber Family Camp
timeline.description: Trek through Black Desert plains. Meet Berber families, learn traditions, and spend the night in a camp far from village lights.

timeline.title: Day 3 — Return via Erg-Chebbi → Merzouga
timeline.description: Walk back through scenic dunes and plateaus to Merzouga village, ending your 3-day trek.

hero.title: Merzouga Desert Trekking & Hiking
hero.subtitle: Explore the Sahara and Erg-Chebbi dunes like a true Berber nomad

journey.title: Explore the Hidden Gems of Merzouga
journey.description1: Hiking in Merzouga takes you deep into the Sahara to discover the hidden beauty of Erg-Chebbi dunes and Black Desert.
journey.description2: Spend peaceful nights under the stars, enjoy candlelight dinners, and meet locals to learn their traditions.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Discover Erg-Chebbi Dunes by Walking
timeline.description: Explore the golden Erg-Chebbi dunes, learn about nomadic life, and enjoy dinner under the stars at camp.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Trek to Erg-Chebbi Dunes & Berber Families
timeline.description: Cross deep desert landscapes to visit local families. Share tea and camp far from village lights to enjoy the night sky.

timeline.title: Day 3 — Hike the Black Desert & Deep Erg-Chebbi Area
timeline.description: Traverse soft sand, black volcanic stones, and hidden oases. Follow nomad routes and ancient caravan paths before resting at camp.

timeline.title: Day 4–7 — Extended Sahara Expeditions
timeline.description: For longer treks, continue toward Znigui, Ouzina, and western Merzouga dunes. New landscapes, nomadic encounters, and unforgettable sunsets each day.

hero.title: 3 Days Trekking from Chefchaouen
hero.subtitle: Explore the Rif Mountains, Waterfalls, and Villages

journey.title: Discover the Rif Mountains and Local Culture
journey.description1: Embark on a 3-day trek through Talassemtane National Park, hiking from Chefchaouen to Akchour. Enjoy forests, rivers, waterfalls, rock formations, and traditional Berber villages along the way.
journey.description2: Stay overnight in local guesthouses, immerse yourself in Moroccan hospitality, and witness stunning natural landscapes including panoramic mountain viewpoints, gorges, and cascades.

timeline.title: Day 1 — Chefchaouen → Tissouka → Afeska
timeline.description: Begin your trek from Chefchaouen along forest paths with panoramic Rif views. Stop at Tissouka for vistas, then continue to the Berber village of Afeska. Evening with a host family in a village guesthouse.

timeline.title: Day 2 — Afeska → God's Bridge → Akchour
timeline.description: Hike through valleys and pine forests to the dramatic natural rock arch known as God's Bridge. Continue to Akchour beside the mountain river. Relax and explore. Overnight in a local guesthouse or eco-lodge.

timeline.title: Day 3 — Akchour → Waterfalls → Chefchaouen
timeline.description: Trek to the famous Akchour waterfalls, enjoy the cascades and natural pools (seasonal), then return to Chefchaouen by local taxi after lunch.

notIncludedItems: Soft drinks and other unspecified beverages
includedItems: Overnight stays in local guesthouses or eco-lodges
All transfers and pick-up from Chefchaouen hotel

footer.tagline: Discover the magic of Morocco with authentic experiences, expert guides, and unforgettable memories in the Atlas Mountains and Sahara Desert.

homepage_tours.description1: Morocco is a land of diverse landscapes, rich history, and vibrant culture. Whether you're seeking immersive city experiences, breathtaking desert adventures, or serene coastal escapes — Morocco has it all.
homepage_tours.description2: Discover unforgettable journeys with Tours from Marrakech, Tours from Fez, Tours from Casablanca, and Tours from Tangier, each offering a unique glimpse into the country's heritage. For shorter getaways, explore Day Trips from Marrakech and Day Trips from Fez, perfect for uncovering nearby hidden gems.
homepage_tours.description3: No adventure in Morocco is complete without thrilling Desert Activities — from camel trekking across the Sahara to exhilarating quad rides over golden dunes. Wherever your journey takes you, Morocco promises culture, adventure, and unforgettable memories.

hero.title: Mount Toubkal Summit Trek
hero.subtitle: Conquer North Africa's highest peak and experience breathtaking Atlas Mountain vistas

journey.title: An Unforgettable Journey to the Roof of North Africa
journey.description1: Embark on an extraordinary adventure to Mount Toubkal, standing majestically at 4,167 meters above sea level. This iconic trek takes you through traditional Berber villages, alpine meadows, and rugged mountain terrain, offering an authentic taste of Morocco's High Atlas Mountains.
journey.description2: Experience the warmth of Berber hospitality, witness stunning sunrise views from the summit, and create memories that will last a lifetime. This carefully crafted journey combines physical challenge with cultural immersion, making it perfect for adventurous travelers seeking both natural beauty and authentic experiences.

highlights.title: Trek Highlights
items: Spectacular sunrise views from the summit

hero.title: Berber Villages Cultural Trek
hero.subtitle: Immerse yourself in authentic Berber culture through remote mountain villages, terraced valleys, and traditional homestays.

journey.title: A Cultural Journey Through the Heart of the Atlas
journey.description1: Discover the charm of Morocco's Berber heartland as you trek through ancient villages nestled among terraced valleys and walnut groves. This immersive experience offers an authentic glimpse into the daily life, traditions, and hospitality of the Berber people.
journey.description2: Spend nights in traditional homestays, savor homemade Moroccan cuisine, and enjoy scenic trails that wind through breathtaking mountain landscapes. Perfect for those seeking a meaningful cultural encounter combined with gentle trekking.

hero.title: Toubkal Grand Traverse
hero.subtitle: The ultimate Atlas expedition for serious trekkers — a 7-day traverse through high passes, remote valleys, and multiple peaks.

journey.title: An Epic Traverse Across the High Atlas
journey.description1: Embark on the ultimate trekking adventure across Morocco's High Atlas range. This challenging 7-day expedition takes you through rugged mountain passes, remote Berber valleys, and breathtaking alpine landscapes. Designed for experienced trekkers seeking a true expedition experience.
journey.description2: You'll cross multiple high passes above 3,000 meters, encounter isolated Berber communities, and explore untouched terrain rarely seen by casual hikers. The journey can optionally include a summit attempt of Mount Toubkal — North Africa's highest peak.

highlights.title: Trek Highlights
items: Traverse remote valleys and untouched landscapes

marrakech-zagora-2days.title: 2 Days from Marrakech to Zagora
marrakech-zagora-2days.subtitle: Sahara desert
marrakech-zagora-2days.overview: Set off on a breathtaking 2-Day Marrakech to Zagora Desert. Travel through the stunning High Atlas Mountains via the Tizi n'Tichka pass, stopping at the UNESCO-listed Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah. Continue to Zagora, where you'll experience an unforgettable camel trek into the desert. Enjoy a magical night under the stars in a traditional Berber camp, complete with local music and a mesmerizing sunrise. On the second day, return to Marrakech, passing through Ouarzazate and taking in the ever-changing desert landscapes. This short yet immersive journey offers a perfect taste of Morocco's natural beauty, history, and culture.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Camel ride and 1 night in desert camp.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – ait ben haddo kasbah – Zagora (camel trekking)
itinerary.description: We'll meet you in Marrakech and drive to Ouarzazate through the dramatic Tizi n tichka pass (2260m), over the High Atlas Mountains, appreciating the fantastic of the landscape on twisted roads through the Berber villages. Arriving at the famous Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah: the oldest Kasbah in Morocco and now a UNESCO matrimonial historical site, housing many Glaoui family members. Lunch is in the Kasbah before continuing to Zagora where your camel waiting for you, guided by an experienced camel-man. You'll explore within the mysterious sea of sand. Here you'll spend the night under the stars, enjoying sunse and sunrise, dinner wil be served there, in addition to a unique drums music played by locals. The area is totally safe which offers a lifetime experience.

itinerary.title: Zagora– back to Marrakech
itinerary.description: After breakfast we'll peacefully camel-trek back to your hotel base. En-route you won't fail to appreciate the unique beauty of the spectacular sand dunes – changing with the light as the day progresses. Arriving late morning back in Zagora and after shower at the guesthouse, we'll leave to Ouarzazate, once again over the Tizi N Tichka pass arriving in Marrakech at the evening in which our 2 days tour ends.

marrakech-merzouga-3days.title: 3 Day Morocco tours from Marrakech to Merzouga Sahara Desert
marrakech-merzouga-3days.subtitle: Sahara Desert Adventure
marrakech-merzouga-3days.overview:
Experience an unforgettable 3-Day Sahara Desert Tour from Marrakech to the breathtaking Sahara Desert and back. Travel through the stunning High Atlas Mountains, visit the UNESCO-listed Kasbah of Aït Benhaddou, and explore the historic city of Ouarzazate. Enjoy a scenic drive through the Valley of Roses and the dramatic landscapes of Dades Gorges.

Venture into the Sahara, passing through Todra Gorges and Erfoud before arriving in Merzouga. Embark on a camel trek into the dunes of Erg Chebbi, where you'll witness a mesmerizing sunset and spend a magical night at a desert camp with traditional Berber music under a starlit sky.

On the final day, ride your camel back to Merzouga, journey through the Draa Valley, and return to Marrakech, concluding an adventure filled with culture, breathtaking landscapes, and unforgettable desert experiences.
highlights: Mountains views of High and Ani Atlas.
Cultural experience by visiting Kasbahs and monuments.
Camel trekking on the dunes of Merzouga.
Night at the Camp within huge Sahara dunes.
Local music in a night party.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Camel ride and 1 night in desert camp.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – High Atlas Mountains – Kasbah of Aït Benhaddou – Ouarzazate – Valley Of Roses – Dades Gorges
itinerary.description:
3 DAY Sahara Desert starts in the morning, your driver/guide, will pick you up from anywhere you are in Marrakech and driver towards Dades Gorges through high atlas mountains" Tizi- N-Tichka " (2260m) higher, a long the way, we will have stops to visit and take pictures for a wonderful landscapes with different colors and the Berber villages… in the mid day, we will arrive to the Old Kasbah of Aït Benhaddou, you will have a free time to visit the Kasbah Aït Benhaddou which has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1987 and several films have been shot there as Gladiator and the Mummy.

After your visit and lunch, we will continue driving to Dades Valley, we will have a stop in Ouarzazate to Visit "Taourirt Kasbah". Afterwards, we go further south east to the green Dades valley and the city of roses via the fascinating Skoura palmery, we will arrive to Dades Valley in the evening overnight in a hotel/Riad with dinner and breakfast.

itinerary.title: Dades Gorges – Todra Gorges – Tinjdad – Erfoud – sahara(Camel trekking and Night in desert Camp)
itinerary.description:
After breakfast and shower, we will start our journey to Merzouga Sahara Desert, before we leave, we will visit Dades Gorges and will be a great chance to take a lovely pictures and nice view to see… we will continue driving toward Tinghir" Todra Gorges " there you will have a free time to walk around, then we go to the Tinjdad town where we will stop for lunch, after lunch we go to Merzouga Desert (where the camel trekking tours start from), we will pass through Erfoud the capital Moroccan city of fossil's, we will arrive to Merzouga in the afternoon around 16:00 to be ready for the camel riding into the Erg Chebbi dunes, before we leave to desert, the camels will be packed with water, food, blankets and everything else which we will need for the trip, each person will have his/her camel, you will ride camels for 1h 30 inside the dunes of Sahara Erg chebbi.At your arrival to the camp "nomad tents" you will leave your luggage in the tent and then you can walk in the dunes to watch the beautiful sunset and try a sand board in the sand dunes.

After seeing the sunset, you will go down back to the camp, you will invite with a cup of tea which we called( Moroccan Berber Whisky ). Then, you will have your meal in the camp " delicious Moroccan Berber tagine ", After dinner, the party will start. Listening to local berber nomads musicians play traditional music with drums and dancing around the campfire, after the party will be great opportunity to watch the magical sky full of stars and take a lovely pictures. Dinner and overnight in nomad camp.

itinerary.title: Camel Riding back to Merzouga – Rissani – Draa Valley – Ouarzazate – Marrakech
itinerary.description: Early morning your " Camel guide " will wake you up to watch the sunrise from the top of dunes.Then, return by camels to the Hotel, after breakfast and shower we start driving to the huge palm grove of Tafilalet through Rissani and with Draa valley arrival at Ouarzazate, here you will have free time for lunch before getting back to Marrakech, Arrival will be in the evening and drop you off at your accommodation. And end of our services.

marrakech-merzouga-8days.title: 8 Days Morocco tour from Marrakech
marrakech-merzouga-8days.subtitle: Sahara Desert Adventure
marrakech-merzouga-8days.overview: Experience an unforgettable 8-day from Marrakech to the Sahara Desert, exploring Morocco's rich history and natural beauty. Start with a sightseeing tour of Marrakech, including iconic sites like the Majorelle Gardens and the Koutoubia Tower. Then, travel through the High Atlas Mountains to the UNESCO-listed Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah and continue to the Dades Valley. Afterward, explore the majestic Erg Chebbi dunes in the Sahara, with a memorable camel trek and night under the stars in a traditional desert camp. Visit Rissani's historic souk, meet nomadic families, and enjoy a Berber meal before heading back to Ouarzazate. Conclude your adventure with scenic drives through the Draa Valley and High Atlas Mountains, returning to Marrakech for your departure. This tour is a perfect blend of history, culture, and adventure.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Camel ride(1 camel for each person) and 1 night in desert camp.
Sandboarding.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Arrive To Marrakech Transfer To Your Riad
itinerary.description: Pick You Up From Airport To Your Accommodation.

itinerary.title: Marrakech Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After Breakfast We'll Explore Marrakech"The Red City Of Morocco". We Will Ensure You See The Most Important Historical And Cultural Sites, Including The Majorelle Gardens, The Koutoubia Tower, The Saadian Tombs, And The Bahia Palace. After Lunch At A Restaurant Near The Square We'll Take A Walk Through The Souks And The Rest Of The Day Will Be At Your Leisure.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah – Ouarzazette – Dades Valley
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad We Will Set Off For The Dades Valley. Passing Through Tizi-N-Tishka Pass In The High Atlas Mountains We Will Visit The Unesco World Heritage Site Of Ait Ben Haddou Which Has Been The Backdrop For Many Films Including Lawrence Of Arabia, Gladiator And Alexander. After Lunch We'll Enjoy The Wonderful Natural Landscapes And Historical Monuments Of Taourirt Kasbah In Ourzazate And The Roses Valley, Famous For Its Annual Festival Of Roses. We'll Also Pass Through The Berber Villages Of El Kelaa Des M'gouna Till Arrive To Dades Valley Where We Will Spend The Night In A Hotel With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Dades Valley – Todra Gorge – Sahara
itinerary.description: Today's Target Point Is Arriving To Sahara Desert Which Is Known For The Highest Sand Dunes In North Africa. It Is Called Erg Chebbi Sahara Desert And It Is About 32 Km Long And 9 Km Wide. On Our Way, We Will Have The Chance To See Many Oasis Such As The Oasis Of Tinjdad. We Will Continue Our Tour Passing Through The Little Berber Towns Of Mellab And Touroug Where We Can Stop For Lunch In A Traditional Moroccan Restaurant. After This Break, We Will Continue Our Way Enjoying The Green Oasis Of Palm Trees Of Tafilalet And The Black Hamada Before Arriving To Merzouga, Where You Will Be Accommodated In A Traditional Moroccan Riad As Well As Having A Local Dinner.

itinerary.title: Erg Chebbi Sahara Sightseeing – Camel Trekking
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In The Riad You'll Start Your Explorative Trip Of The Area, Starting By Visiting The 'Village Of The Blacks', Originally Slaves From Sudan, Mali And Senegal To Experience Their Music And Lifestyle. Later, We Will Drive In The Desert Area To Meet Nomad Families-Living Under Berber Tents- To Explore Their Way Of Life. Today Our Lunch Will Be A Traditional Berber Meal (Berber Pizza) With A Local Family. You Will Have The Option Also To Visit The Old City Of Rissani – The Foundation Of The Alaouite Dynasty – The Current Ruling Royal Family In Morocco. Rissani Is Surrounded By About 360 Ksar(A Fortified Village With Many Towers) And Has A Big Souk (An Open Market), Held Three Times A Week. Once Called Sijilmassa, This Was The Meeting Place For The Salt Caravans, Coming From Tombouctou In Mali. Here You'll Walk Through The Souk, Selling Spices, Vegetables And Cloths. After That, We Drive Back To The Village Of Merzouga. In The Afternoon, You Will Ride Your Camel Guided By An Experienced Camel-Man To Explore What Is Hidden In The Middle Of The Highest Sand Dunes In Morocco. The Camel Trek Takes About 1hr30 Min To The Camp Where You Will Enjoy The Sunset And Make A Deep Vision On The Sky By Its Stars And Shining Moon. Dinner Will Be Served In Front Of The Tent Where You Will Spend The Night. After Dinner You Will Have Chance To Song Berber Music With Drums Played By Locals.

itinerary.title: Merzouga – Draa Valley – Ouarzazate
itinerary.description: Before Sunrise, You Will Be Woken Up To Climb The Sand Dunes For Fantastic Pictures, And Watch What Well May Be The Best Sunrise In Your Life. After breakfast we continue Our Journey To Ouarzazate, Passing Through Alnif, Tazzarine, Nkob, And The Fantastic Draa Valley. We Will Spend The Night In A Guest House In Ouarzazate With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Ouarzazette – High Atlas Mountains – Marrakech
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Will Set Off For Marrakech, Passing Through The Spectacular High Atlas Mountains Again With Stops Before We Get To Your Riad In Marrakech.

itinerary.title: Transfer To The Airport
itinerary.description: Airport Transfer Where Our 8 Days Tour From Marrakech To Sahara Desert Ends.

marrakech-casablanca-11days.title: 11 Days Tour from Marrakech to Casablanca
marrakech-casablanca-11days.subtitle: Complete Morocco Adventure
marrakech-casablanca-11days.overview: This 11-day Morocco adventure takes you on a captivating journey through the country's rich culture, breathtaking landscapes, and historical landmarks. Starting in Marrakech, you'll explore the city's vibrant sights, including the Koutoubia Tower and Jemaa el-Fna Square, before heading towards the Atlas Mountains, Ait Benhaddou, and Dades Valley. Enjoy the majestic desert dunes of Merzouga with a camel ride and a luxurious camp experience. The tour continues through Rissani, Erfoud, and Midelt, reaching the spiritual city of Fes, where you will visit the UNESCO-listed medina and historic sites like the Qarawiyyin University. You'll also explore the Roman ruins of Volubilis and the imperial city of Meknes before experiencing the charm of Chefchaouen's blue-painted streets. The journey ends with visits to Rabat and Casablanca, where you'll tour the iconic Hassan II Mosque before departing from Mohammed V Airport. Perfect for those seeking an immersive experience of Morocco's history, culture, and natural beauty.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Camel ride(1 camel for each person) and 1 night in desert camp.
Sandboarding.
Drop you off to your accommodation.
Bed & Breakfast in Marrakech, Fes, Chefchaouen and Casablanca.
Jeep/4×4 if needed to reach the Camp( alternative of Camel).
notIncluded: Dinner in Marrakesh, Fes, Chefchaouen and Casablanca.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Marrakech and pick up to the Riad
itinerary.description: You will be welcomed by our team at MARRAKESH Menara Airport and drive to your accommodation in the AUTHENTIC part of the city.

itinerary.title: MARRAKESH sightseeing, guided tour
itinerary.description:
After breakfast in your Riad, you will start to explore MARRAKESH " the red city of Morocco". You will visit the sites of historical and cultural interest, including the the Koutoubia Tower, the Bahia Palace, Ben Youssef Medrassa… And main square place of Jamaa Elfna. After lunch you will walk through the souks and view hundreds of handicrafts. Marrakech nicknamed the "Red City" for its old red sandstone city walls and buildings. It has Berber rather than Arab roots and was an important trading capital for tribes of the Atlas Mountains. Orient yourself around Marrakech's bustling Jemaa el-Fna Square : the souks are to the north, the Koutoubia Mosque and Gardens to the west and the kasbah area with the Saadian Tombs, Bahia Palace, and El Badi Palace are to the south. In the new city, you will find the Majorelle Gardens.

You will have free time in the evening while you finish the guided tour, night will be in the same Riad.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – High Atlas – Ait Benhaddou – Dades Valley 360km
itinerary.description:
Will pick you up from your Riad at 08;30 am before embarking on an interesting journey through fascinating landscapes. You'll initially drive through the spectacular High Atlas Mountains with its snow-capped peaks most of the year. Cross the Tizi n'Tichka Pass (2260 m) while enjoying the breathtaking views of the "Berber" Amazigh Villages that are built primarily in adobe & stones by the ever-flowing river. Within these villages we are going to visit Argan Cooperative where local women are going to abstract different products… this place is known as the best for pure and high quality of Argan oil compared to the mian cities.

You'll take a walking tour of the UNESCO listed Ait Benhaddou Village. This dramatic village consists of numerous (fortresses) that are a striking sample of the southeastern architecture with high four towers & small atop windows. It has been used as a backdrop for shooting national & international films such as Gladiator, Lawrence of Arabia, Sahara, Kingdom of Heaven, Prince of Persia and many others.

We continue to through Ouarzazate (Hollywood of Africa) with the possibility to include a visit to the local Atlas Film Studios. Drive through the palm-dotted oasis of Skoura, Valley of Roses before reaching Boumalne Dades where we will spend our night. (Dinner & Breakfast are Included) 360 klm.

itinerary.title: Dades Valley – Todra Gorge – Merzouga & Camel Ride 255 klm
itinerary.description: After having breakfast in your hotel, we will resume our journey further Southeast to the Sahara Desert of Erg Chebbi. Stretch your legs in the impressive Todra Gorge (Canyon) that offers an excellent opportunity to enjoy the breathtaking views with the possibility to spot mountain climbers along with locals who would come to enjoy the cooler weather compared to other parts of the South. You'll drive through the palm oasis of Tinjdad where we may have lunch, then continue to the Desert through the administrative center of Erfoud. After a while we reach Merzouga Desert, you leave the Car and you'll have your camel ride experience through the golden sand dunes of Erg Chebbi. Enjoy the stunning views of the sunset with the possibility to do the sand-boarding before reaching the luxury desert camp where you'll have a delicious dinner within the Camp. After that, we will have New Year's entertainment; special local music… You can enjoy the starry sky in a romantic atmosphere. Overnight in a Desert Camp by the sand dunes : private tent with hot water : shower and WC (Dinner & Breakfast are Included)

itinerary.title: Merzouga – Rissani – Erfoud – Midelt – Zaida 304km
itinerary.description:
After a stunning sunrise view on the dunes of Sahara and breakfast, we continue back to the Van. We start our day by visiting the town of Khamlia where most of inhabitants originally from Sudan and Mali, even they are intergrated in local culture but, they still conserve their African Gnawa music. We are going to listen to their spiritual music in one of the associations. After that, we continue to a famous local market of Rissani where we are going to walk around to discover this unique Souk and to admire the variety of products…

From Rissani we pass by Erfoud known as the Capital of fossils in Morocco ; we do a visit of fossils factory to get more info about. Lunch will be in one of the Villages, then we drive through Ziz Gorges, Medilt before we reach Zaida where we are going to spend the night near Milddle Atlas Mountains.

itinerary.title: Timhdet – Cedar Forest – Ifrane – Fes 160Km
itinerary.description: After having breakfast, we will head north to the spiritual city of Fes by driving through Middle Atlas Mountains till we reach the UNESCO preserved cedar forest. This forest hosts a colony of Barbary Apes that you can possibly meet & feed. Have a break in the beautiful city of Ifran before reaching Fes in the late afternoon.

itinerary.title: Guided Tour of Fes
itinerary.description: Today, you'll have an interesting day of what Fes has to offer. Your local tour guide will share with you his/her knowledge of this authentic city. Enjoy the views of the Fes el-Bali (Oldest Fes), this UNESCO listed Medina as a World Heritage Site is the largest car-free district in the world. Cars have no space here & only mules and donkeys are the only means of transportation. We will start by visiting the outside part: to take pictures by the golden gates of the Royal Palace, then stretch your legs in the vibrant Jewish Mellah (Quarter) where you'll learn about the role that the Jews played in turning Fes into a main commercial center then to the famous Ceramic pottery and back to Medina. Now, it's time to get inside the vibrant & the authentic Fes el-Bali. You'll visit the local museums, pass by the old Medersas (Koranic Schools) including the Qarawiyyin University & Mosque (The Oldest University in the Islamic World). Visit the Chouara Tanneries where you can learn about how leather is being made using traditional methods & ingredients. Your tour guided will escort you back to your Riad in the late afternoon.

itinerary.title: Fès – Meknès – Volubilis-Chefchaouen 282klm
itinerary.description: After having breakfast in your Riad, you'll continue on the track further north with a nice drive through the spectacular Rif Mountains that offer majestic views. While including a visit to the Roman Ruins of Volubilis where you can have a guided tour with a local guide. You'll learn about the Roman lifestyle when they settled in Morocco. Before Volubilis we are going to discover the Imperial city of Meknes, this unique city goes back to the 17th century when the late Sultan Moulay Ismail put the solid ground for the Alaouite Dynasty that is still ruling Morocco to this day. We'll include a short break by the impressive Bab Mansour Gate with its geometric designs depicting the elaborate Moroccan Islamic Architecture. Stretch your legs in the vibrant El-Hedim Square and the olive market before driving through the High Walls of the Royal Palace. You'll arrive at the Granaries & stables where the Sultan used to store grains & barley along with the stables where feeding and looking after the 12000 royal horses used to take place. We are going to have lunch somewhere in Rif Mountains before reaching the blue-painted city of Chefchaouen in the late afternoon. You may want to stretch your legs in the evening to get a first glimpse of this unique but charming city.

itinerary.title: full Day to discover Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: Today, you will spend all the day meandering around the blue-painted streets of Chefchaouen Medina starting from the vibrant Utta Hammam, which is located in the heart of Medina. You may want to visit the Kasbah (fortress) where you can learn that it's the reason behind the foundation of Chefchaouen by the warrior Moulay Ali Ibn Rashid to organize attacks against the Portuguese & Spanish invaders. Continue on the track to the Ras el-Ma Spring offering stunning views with local women washing clothes & carpets. You may want to have a soft hike up to the mosque where you can get a complete view of the old Medina of Chefchaouen. Night in the same Riad.

itinerary.title: Chefchaouen – Rabat- Casablanca 340klm
itinerary.description: We leave Chefchaouen and drive West to Casablanca through many local villages and the Capital administrative of the Kingdom Rabat. We are going to visit the main attractions of Rabat like Hassan Tower and Kasbah Ouadaya. After lunch we drive to Casablanca where we pass the night.

itinerary.title: visit the famous Hassan II mosque- Driver to Mohammed V Airport
itinerary.description: Casablanca is a giant city with high skyscrapers turning into the economic capital of Morocco. You'll have a guided tour of the Hassan II Mosque(The only mosque which Non-Muslims are allowed to visit in Morocco), is the focal point and the landmark of the city. The Mosque is the third largest religious building in the Islamic World & is an actual masterpiece of architecture depicting the unique Moroccan & Andalusian craftsmanship. After that, Will drive to the Airport where our service gets to end.

fes-marrakech-2days.title: 2 Days Desert Tour From Fes to Marrakech
fes-marrakech-2days.subtitle: Sahara Desert Adventure
fes-marrakech-2days.overview: Experience the best 2-day Sahara Desert tour from Fes to Marrakech, a perfect choice for travelers with limited time who still want to explore Morocco's stunning desert landscapes. This tour offers a unique journey through the Sahara Desert, where you'll experience camel trekking across the Erg Chebbi dunes, spend a night in a desert camp under the stars, and visit breathtaking locations like Ifrane, the Cedar Forest, Midelt, and the Ziz Gorges. Along the way, explore Kasbahs, gorges, and palm oases, and enjoy sand-boarding in the dunes. The journey also includes stops at Rissani and Ait Ben Haddou, both steeped in history, and a drive through the Atlas Mountains. With comfortable accommodation options and the opportunity to immerse yourself in the Sahara's tranquil beauty, this short tour offers an unforgettable Moroccan adventure.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Overnight in Sahara Camp with Dinner and Breakfast.
Camel per person to reach the Camp.
Sandboarding.

itinerary.title: Fes- Ifran- Cedar- Forest- Midelt- Merzouga- Camel Trekking
itinerary.description: Our Crew Will Meet You At Your Accommodation Early As Much As Possible Then Drive Towards The South East Of Morocco Out Of The City Crowd Passing By Many Berber Villages, Our First Stop Will Be In One Of The Cleanest Moroccan Town Called Ifrane Which Known As Switzerland Of Morocco, From Here To The Largest Cedar Forest Of Azrou Where You Will Have The Chance To See Wild Monkeys Jumping Between The Trees. The Tour To Sahara Desert Continue To Midelt ; One Of The Small Cities In Atlas Mountains, Here You Will Have Lunch If You Mind. After, We Cross High Atlas Mountains From Tizi N Talghmt To Reach Ziz Gorges Where You Will Notice The Change Of Landscape From The Whole Green To Desert One. After A Couple Hours Of Driving You Will Get To Merzouga Sahara Desert Where You Will Have A Lifetime Experience Starts By Camel Trekking [Around 1h30] Going Up And Down On The Dunes With Several Stops To Capture A Unique Pictures Of The View And Of Sunset Before Getting To The Camp; Could Be Luxury Or Standard One Depends On Your Choice. You Will Be Welcome With A Cup Of Tea While You Get To The Camp, Then The Staff Will Guide You To Your Accommodation Which Is A Comfortable Tent. A Delicious Dinner Will Be Served At The Camp After The Ambiance Takes Over; Local Drums Music Played By The Staff Under The Starry Sky. Sahara Desert Atmosphere Offers A Fantastic Moments In Which The Person Being In Contact With The Silence And Tranquility Of Nature.

itinerary.title: Merzouga- Rissani- Agdez- Ourzazate- Ait Ben Haddo- Marrakech
itinerary.description: You Will Wake Up Early To Enjoy The Beauty Of Sunrise And Take Pictures, Then Having Breakfast And Shower Before The Journey Back; Either By Camel Or 4×4 In Order To Save Time Accordingly To The Distance To Marrakech, To Merzouga Village Where Your Driver Waiting For You. The Itinerary Will Make You To Pass Through Rissani; The Foundation Of Alaoui Dynasty Which Is Ruling Morocco Till Now, Alinf, Tazarine And Rock Desert Till You Reach Ouarzazate; Know As The Hollywood Of Africa, International Movies Have Been Shot In Its Film Studios Such As Gladiator, Game Of Thrones… After Having Lunch, We Continue Our Sahara Desert Tour From Fes To The Famous And Oldest Kasbah In Morocco Ait Ben Haddou[Part Unesco Since 1987] A Break To Take Pictures Of This Mud Building From A Panoramic View, Then To Cross High Atlas Mountains From The Pass Of Tizi N Tichka With Elevation Of 2260m Before You Get To Marrakech Where Sahara Desert Trip From Fes Gets To End.

fes-casablanca-3days.title: 3 days tour from Fes to Casablanca via chefchaouen
fes-casablanca-3days.subtitle: Morocco Cities Tour
fes-casablanca-3days.overview: Start your 3-day Morocco tour from Fes to Casablanca, with visits to the enchanting Chefchaouen, historic Meknes, and the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. On Day 1, depart from Fes, explore Meknes and the ruins of Volubilis, then spend the night in the blue-painted medina of Chefchaouen. Day 2 offers a free morning to discover Chefchaouen before heading to Tangier, with an overnight stay in the coastal town of Assilah. On Day 3, visit Rabat's historic monuments before concluding your journey in the vibrant city of Casablanca. This tour is flexible to fit your schedule and preferences, so feel free to contact us for personalized adjustments to your itinerary.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfort transport with A/C.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Highly recomended accommodations in Chefchaouen and Assilah.

itinerary.title: Fes to Chefchaouen and Tangier
itinerary.description: Start your unforgettable 3-day tour from Fes at 8:30 AM, when your driver will pick you up to embark on a scenic journey toward Chefchaouen, the blue city nestled in the Rif Mountains. Chefchaouen is famous for its stunning blue-washed buildings and narrow, charming streets. Take time to wander through this picturesque town, often referred to as the "Blue Pearl of Morocco." Enjoy a delightful lunch as you soak in the beauty of this serene destination. Next, continue your journey to Tangier, with a stop at the UNESCO World Heritage site of Volubilis, an ancient Roman city that offers a glimpse into Morocco's rich history. By evening, you'll reach Tangier, a bustling port city on the Strait of Gibraltar. After a day of exploration, you'll be dropped off at your hotel in Tangier to relax and rest for the next day's adventure.

itinerary.title: Tangier to Asilah, Rabat, and Casablanca
itinerary.description: After a hearty breakfast at the hotel, begin your day with a tour of Tangier. Visit the highlights of this lively city, including the Grand Mosque, the Medina, and the American Legation Museum. Enjoy panoramic views of the coast from Cape Spartel, and explore the Cave of Hercules. Next, head to the coastal town of Asilah, known for its stunning blue-and-white architecture and laid-back vibe. Stroll through its quaint streets, visit the 18th-century fortress, and enjoy breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. After lunch in Asilah, continue your journey to Rabat, the capital of Morocco. Here, you'll discover the city's historical treasures, including the iconic Hassan Tower, a remarkable Minaret from 1195 AD, and the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and Hassan II. Explore the tranquil Andalusian Gardens and the Kasbah of the Udayas before departing for Casablanca. Arriving in Casablanca, Morocco's economic hub, you'll be dropped off at your accommodation to unwind and enjoy a delicious dinner.

itinerary.title: Discovering Casablanca's Iconic Sights
itinerary.description: On the final day of your tour, start by visiting the impressive Hassan II Mosque, one of the largest mosques in the world. This architectural marvel, with Africa's tallest minaret, is open to non-Muslim visitors. Remember to remove your shoes and cover your head before entering. Next, explore the Old Medina, the historic heart of Casablanca. Wander through its narrow streets, admire the traditional Moroccan architecture, and experience the vibrant atmosphere. Afterward, visit Place Mohammed V, the main square in the Old Medina, a great spot to relax and people-watch. Then, head to Ville Nouvelle, the modern center of Casablanca, home to the city's business district, shopping centers, and trendy restaurants. End your tour with a visit to Place des Nations Unies, a lively square in Ville Nouvelle that's popular with both locals and visitors. If you're in the mood for nightlife, Casablanca has plenty to offer, from vibrant bars to entertainment venues. After a day filled with sightseeing, your driver will drop you off at your hotel, marking the end of your unforgettable 3-day tour through Morocco's cities.

fes-marrakech-7days.title: 7 Days Desert Tour From Fes
fes-marrakech-7days.subtitle: Complete Morocco Experience
fes-marrakech-7days.overview: Take part in a breathtaking 7-day journey through Morocco, from the historical city of Fes to the vibrant streets of Marrakech. Explore Fes's rich cultural heritage, including the Al Karaouine Mosque and the Royal Palace. Journey through the stunning landscapes of the Middle Atlas Mountains, where you'll visit the charming town of Ifrane and encounter Barbary monkeys in Azrou. Continue your adventure to the Sahara Desert, where you'll experience the tranquility of Merzouga's dunes, enjoy a camel trek, and sleep under the stars. Discover the beauty of Todra Gorge, Dades Valley, and the cinematic allure of Ouarzazate. Visit the UNESCO World Heritage site of Ait Benhaddou, and end your journey with a full exploration of Marrakech's gardens, palaces, and bustling souks. This well-rounded tour combines Morocco's history, culture, nature, and modern vibrancy, leaving you with lasting memories.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Camel ride and 1 night in desert camp.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Fez Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, You Will Start Exploring Fes" The Spiritual City Of Morocco". You Will Spend The Whole Morning Exploring The Medina, Visiting Most Of The Sites With Cultural And Historical Interest – Including The Famous Al Karaouine Mosque And University (The Oldest In The World), The Tanneries And The Najjarine Fountain. After Lunch, We Will Drive Outside The Medina To See The Royal Palace Gate, Walk Through The Jewish Quarter" The Mellah", Then To Visit The Pottery Cooperative. Afternoon, We Will Drive To One Of The Fortresses To Experience An Amazing Panoramic View Of The Whole Medina Of Fes. Overnight Accommodation Will Be In An Authentic Riad In The Heart Of Old Medina.

itinerary.title: Fez – Ifrane – Azrou – Medilt – Sahara
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Leave Fes And Driving Towards The Magical Middle Atlas Mountains. We Will Stop In The Charming Town Of Ifrane; Which Known As 'Switzerland Of Morocco', Because Of The Weather, Architecture And Historical Events. We Will Have A Short Break In Order To Walk Around Before We Continue To The Largest Cedar Forest Of Morocco Beside A Beautiful Town Of Azrou, Where You Will Have Chance To See Barbary Monkeys Living In A Wild Area. After That, We Keep Driving Between The Mountains Passing Through Many Berber Villages Like Timhdit, Zaida And Medilt. Then We Drive Further South Crossing The Mountains Of The High Atlas Till We Get To Errachidia Where The Valley Of Palm Trees Appears, These Create An Oasis Of Greenery Ideal For Growing All Kinds Of Fruit Trees And Vegetables Microclimate. After A While We Reach Erfoud; The Capital Of Fossils, Which Abound Testifying Past Covered By The Sea. From Here The Asphalt Disappears, Saharan Tracks Adobe Till We Reach The Village Of Merzouga; The Main Town In Sahara Desert. Overnight At The Hotel Closed To The Dunes With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Merzouga Sightseeing
itinerary.description: In This Interesting Day We Will Explore Erg Chebbi More Deeply. We Will Visit The Town Of Khamlia, We Discover Small Villages And Inhabited Houses In Unexpected Places Far From Civilization. In Addition To That, We Will Visit Nomads Who Feel So Happy To Share Their Lifestyle With Their Visitors. Our Journey Continue To Discover An Old Mines Closed To The Borders Between Morocco And Algeria, Found By French Since Many Years Ago. Then We Go Back To The Town Where We Will Have A Typical Lunch Especially Of The Area Called" Berber Pizza". After Having Lunch You Will Have A Lifetime Experience Starts By Camel Trekking; Friendly Camels Guided By A Man With Experience Of Many Years Going Up And Down On Sand With Different Stops To Take Pictures Of Landscapes And Amazing Sunset, Around 1h30 Walking We Get To The Camp; Located In The Heart Of Desert Where You Will Have Your Dinner And Enjoy The Berber Music Played By Locals Under A Starry Sky. In The Morning You Will Wake Up Early In Order To Admire The Fascinating View Of Sunrise, Before You Go Back To The Hotel By Riding Your Camel Again Till The Hotel Where You Will Have Breakfast And Take A Shower.

itinerary.title: Merzouga – Todra Gorge – Dades Valley – Ouarzazate
itinerary.description: After Breakfast We Departure To Rissani; Old Sijilmassa Center Of Ancient Caravans From Toumboukto To Marrakech As Center Market Of Salt. After Walking Around The Biggest Market Of The Region We Continue Our Trip Through A Semi-Desert Landscape Till We Reach The Oasis Of Tinghir, One Of The Wonderful Places In Morocco. Then We Get To Todra Gorges Highest And Narrowest Gorges With 300m Which Considered An Attractive Place For Climbers. After Having Lunch, We Continue The Way Until Another Impressive Valley Of Dades And To The City Of Roses; The Area Where The Real Flower Grows Called Damskina, Short Break If You Are Interested To See How They Abstract Different Products From Roses In One Of The Cooperatives There. Then, We Drive Through A Famous Road Known As" Road Of Thousand Kasbahs" To Reach One Of The Most Important Cities Of Southern Morocco Ouarzazate, Known For Its Intense And Cinematic Activity, Having To His Credit Films Like Gladiator, Troy, The Mummy Etc Made In A Big Studio Called Atlas Corporation Studios, You Can Have A Visit Before We Get To The Hotel Where We Will Spend The Night With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Ouarzazate – Ait Benhaddou -Marrakech
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Take The Road Towards Ait Ben Haddou, The Queen Of Kasbahs (Unesco World Heritage) And Walk Around. Later We Will Visit One Of The Most Wonderful Tracks Of Morocco"Kasbah Of Telouet", Ancient Glagui's Palace Pacha Of Marrakech. We Continue Our Way Through The Port Of Highest Pass In Morocco – Tzin Tichca (2,260 M), Where We Will Have Breaks For Panoramic Views And Lunch Before We Reach The Imperial City Of Marrakech. Overnight At Riad.

itinerary.title: Marrakech City Tour
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Spend Full Day Tour To Discover Marrakech With A Local Guide. Called "The Red City" Because Of The Color Of Its Walls And Filled With Gardens, Watered By Underground Wells (Khettaras), Which Were Built By The Almoravids And Saharan Nomads In The Eleventh Century. In This Day We Will Visit Menara, The Saadian Tombs, The Bahia Palace, The Koutoubia, Majorelle Gardens And Souks, These Are Some Of The Unavoidable Visits. A Unique Experience Will Be To Discover The Square Of" Djemaa El Fna" Where Life And Activity Of The City Is Concentrated: Dancers, Storytellers, Jugglers, Artisans, Merchants And Snake Charmers. While You Discover These Important Places You Will Have Free Time To Walk By Yourselves. Overnight In The Same Riad.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – Airport
itinerary.description: Free Time Until Your Flight Departure Then We Drive To Airport And This Will Be The End Of The Tour

fes-marrakech-9days.title: 9 Days Desert Tour From Fes
fes-marrakech-9days.subtitle: Ultimate Morocco Journey
fes-marrakech-9days.overview: Experience the magic of Morocco on a 9-day Sahara Desert tour from Fes to Marrakech, a journey that combines adventure, culture, and breathtaking landscapes. Begin your adventure with a scenic day trip to Chefchaouen, the famous Blue Pearl of Morocco, nestled in the Rif Mountains. Explore the historical and cultural sites of Fes, including the Al Karaouine Mosque, the world's oldest university, and the vibrant Medina of Fes. Continue through the Middle Atlas Mountains to the Sahara Desert, where you'll experience camel trekking in the Erg Chebbi dunes and spend a night under the stars at a desert camp. Visit the stunning Todra Gorge, the Dades Valley, and the famous Kasbah Ait Benhaddou, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Journey through the cinematic city of Ouarzazate, known as the Hollywood of Morocco, and admire panoramic views from the Tizi n'Tichka Pass in the High Atlas Mountains. Conclude your tour with a full day of sightseeing in Marrakech, exploring the iconic Djemaa El Fna Square, Majorelle Gardens, Saadian Tombs, and the Koutoubia Mosque. Enhance your experience with an optional day trip to Ouzoud Waterfalls, Essaouira, or Ourika Valley, or relax and soak in the vibrant atmosphere of Marrakech. This 9-day Morocco desert tour offers the perfect balance of adventure, culture, and relaxation, giving you a deep dive into the best of Morocco's history, desert landscapes, and imperial cities.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Camel ride and 1 night in desert camp.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Day Trip To Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: Departure At 8 Am, It's A Full Day Trip Around 3 Hours Driving Through Fascinating Landscape; Green Mountains And Small Villages With Stops To Admire The View. Within Rif Mountains Located The Calmest And Relax Village Of Chefchaouen Which Has Multiple Nicknames Such As; Blue Pearl, Blue City… While You Get There You Will Have Free Time To Walk And Explore The Medina, Its Walls Are Washed In Blue And White, These Colors Offer A Fantastic Place For Photography. You Will Discover Many Things Thant Attracted The Visiters Like Old Kasbah, Market, Waterfall And Spanish Mosque In The Top Which Offers A Unique Veiw Of The Medina. After Doing A Complet Visit And Having Your Lunch, We Will Drive Back To Fes By The Same Road, Around 7 Pm Will Reach Fes, Night In The Same Riad.

itinerary.title: Fez Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, You Will Start Exploring Fes The "The Sprititual City Of Morocco". You Will Spend The Whole Morning Exploring The Medina, Visiting Most Of The Sites With Cultural And Historical Interest – Including The Famous Al Karaouine Mosque And University (The Oldest In The World), The Tanneries And The Najjarine Fountain. After Lunch, We Will Drive Outside The Medina To See The Royal Palace Gate, Walk Through The Jewish Quarter "The Mellah", Then To Visit The Pottery Cooperative. Afternoon, We Will Drive To One Of The Fortresses To Experience An Amazing Panoramic View Of The Whole Medina Of Fes. Overnight Accommodation Will Be In An Authentic Riad In The Heart Of Old Medina.

itinerary.title: Fez – Ceder Forest – Midelt- Sahara
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Leave Fes And Driving Towards The Magical Middle Atlas Mountains. We Will Stop In The Charming Town Of Ifrane; Which Known As 'Switzerland Of Morocco', Becuase Of The Weather, Architecture And Historical Events. We Will Have A Short Break In Order To Walk Around Before We Continue To The Largest Cedar Forest Of Morocco Beside A Beautiful Town Of Azrou, Where You Will Have Chance To See Barbary Monkeys Living In A Wild Area. After That, We Keep Driving Between The Mountains Passing Through Many Berber Villages Such As; Timhdit And Zaida Till We Reach Midelt Where We Will Have Lunch, Then We Drive Further South Crossing The Mountains Of The High Atlas Till We Get To Errachidia Where The Valley Of Palm Trees Appears, These Create An Oasis Of Greenery Ideal For Growing All Kinds Of Fruit Trees And Vegetables Microclimate. After A While We Reach Erfoud; The Capital Of Fossils, Which Abound Testifying Past Covered By The Sea. From Here The Asphalt Disappears, Saharan Tracks Adobe Till We Reach The Village Of Merzouga; The Main Town In Sahara Desert. Overnight At The Hotel Closed To The Dunes With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Sahara Sightseeing And Camel Trekking
itinerary.description: In This Interesting Day We Will Explore Erg Chebbi More Deeply. We Will Visit The Town Of Khamlia, We Discover Small Villages And Inhabited Houses In Unexpected Places Far From Civilization. In Addition To That We Will Visit Nomads Who Feel So Happy To Share Their Lifestyle With Their Visitors. Our Journey Continue To Discover An Old Mines Closed To The Borders Between Morocco And Algeria, Found By French Since Years Ago. Then We Go Back To The Town Where We Will Have A Typical Lunch Especially Of The Area Called " Berber Pizza". Afternoon You Have A Lifetime Experience Starts By Camel Trekking; Friendly Camels Guided By A Man With Experience Of Many Years Going Up And Down On Sand With Different Stops To Take Pictures Of Landscapes And Amazing Sunset, Around 1h30 On The Camel You Get To The Camp Located In The Heart Of Desert Where You Will Have Your Dinner And Enjoy The Berber Music Played By Locals Under A Starry Sky, You Will Be Welcomed With A Cup Of Mint Tea Then The Workers Will Show You Your Tent And Luggage. In The Morning You Will Wake Up Early In Order To Admire The Fascinating View Of Sunrise Before Having Breakfast And Shower. Then Back With Camels Till The Same Place Where You Had Departure The Day Before.

itinerary.title: Merzouga – Todra Gorges – Dades Valley
itinerary.description: This Day You Will Find Your Driver Waiting For You Then Departure To Rissani; Old Sijilmassa Center Of Ancient Caravans From Toumboukto To Marrakech As Center Market Of Salt. After Walking Aroud The Biggest Market Of The Region We Continue Our Trip Through A Semi-Desert Landscape Till We Reach The Oasis Of Tinghir, One Of The Wonderful Places In Morocco .Then We Get To Todra Gorges Highest And Narrowest Gorges With 300m Which Considered An Attractive Place For Climbers. After Having Lunch, We Continue The Way Until Another Impressive Valley Of Dades Where We Will Spend The Night In A Hotel With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Dades- City Of Roses- Ouarzazate– Ait Benhaddou- Marrakech
itinerary.description: After Breakfast We Take The Road Towards City Of Roses; The Area Where The Real Flower Grows Called Damskina, Short Break If You Are Interested To See How They Abstract Different Products From Roses In One Of The Cooperatives There. Then, We Drive Through A Famous Road Known As" Road Of Thousand Kasbahs", To Reach One Of The Most Important Cities Of Southern Morocco Ouarzazate, Known For Its Intense And Cinematic Activity, Having To His Credit Films Like Gladiator, Troy, The Mummy Etc Made In A Big Studio Called Atlas Corporation Studios, You Can Have A Visit After We Drive To Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah, The Queen Of Kasbahs (Unesco World Heritage) And Walk Around. After Lunch We Continue Our Way Through The Port Of Highest Pass In Morocco – Tzin Tichca (2,260 M), Where We Will Have Breaks For Panoramic Views Before We Reach The Imperial City Of Marrakech. Overnight At Riad.

itinerary.title: Marrakech City Tour
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Spend Full Day Tour To Discover Marrakech With A Local Guide. Called "The Red City" Because Of The Color Of Its Walls And Filled With Gardens, Watered By Underground Wells (Khettaras), Which Were Built By The Almoravids And Saharan Nomads In The Eleventh Century. In This Day We Will Visit Menara, The Saadian Tombs, The Bahia Palace, The Koutoubia, Majorelle Gardens And Souks, These Are Some Of The Unavoidable Visits. A Unique Experience Will Be To Discover The Square Of" Djemaa El Fna" Where Life And Activity Of The City Is Concentrated: Dancers, Storytellers, Jugglers, Artisans, Merchants And Snake Charmers. While You Discover These Important Places You Will Have Free Time To Walk By Yourselves. Overnight In The Same Riad.

itinerary.title: Optional Day
itinerary.description: On your 9-day Sahara Desert tour, you have the opportunity to choose from some of the most famous day trips from Marrakech, or simply unwind and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of the city. You can opt for: Ouzoud Waterfalls: Explore the stunning Ouzoud Waterfalls, one of Morocco's most beautiful natural attractions. Located in the Atlas Mountains, this picturesque site offers breathtaking views and opportunities to hike, swim, and spot wild monkeys. Essaouira: Take a day trip to the coastal town of Essaouira, known for its charming medina, UNESCO-listed historic sites, and beautiful beaches. This relaxing escape offers a mix of culture, history, and stunning ocean views. Ourika Valley: Visit the Ourika Valley, a lush oasis nestled in the Atlas Mountains. Known for its scenic beauty, traditional Berber villages, and waterfalls, it's the perfect getaway for nature lovers and those seeking adventure. Alternatively, if you prefer to relax, you can spend the day enjoying the rich cultural experiences and vibrant atmosphere of Marrakech, from its bustling souks to its tranquil gardens.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – Airport
itinerary.description: Free Time Until Your Flight Departure Then We Drive To Airport And This Will Be The End Of The Tour

tangier-marrakech-4days.title: 4 Days Desert Tour From Tangier
tangier-marrakech-4days.subtitle: Tangier to Marrakech Adventure
tangier-marrakech-4days.overview: Experience an unforgettable 4-day Morocco desert tour from Tangier to Marrakech, exploring the blue city of Chefchaouen, the historic streets of Fes, and the breathtaking Sahara Desert. Ride camels across the Erg Chebbi dunes, spend a magical night in a desert camp, and journey through the Todra Gorge and Dades Valley. Discover the famous Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah, a UNESCO World Heritage site, before crossing the High Atlas Mountains via the Tizi n'Tichka Pass to reach Marrakech. This Tangier to Marrakech desert tour blends adventure, culture, and breathtaking landscapes—perfect for travelers looking to explore the real Morocco.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
3 Nights in a hotel & Camp.
Camel ride in the Sahara desert ( a Camel Per person).
Dinners and Breakfasts.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Tangier – Chefchaouen – Fes
itinerary.description: During the first day of your trip we will meet you where you are and drive through the Rif mountains passing by Tetaoun city to enjoy the views of the wonderful mountains until we get into Chefchaouaen which considered one of the stunning villages in the feet of Rif mountains. Chefchaouen medina had a Spanish-style square surrounded by many funky arts and crafts stores, roof-top restaurants and cafes, where you will have lunch before we continue our way to Fes where we will spend the night in Moroccan riad.

itinerary.title: Fez – Ifrane – Erfoud – Sahara Desert
itinerary.description: After breakfast We will drive south to Ifrane and Azrou through the Middle Atlas mountains. On the way we will stop at the cedar forests to see the Barbarian Monkeys in their natural habitat. Travelling through the Tizi Ntalghamt pass and along the magnificent Ziz Gorges carved through volcanic rock, you'll see views of the Middle-Atlas plateau and the scenery changing to reveal hints of the desert as you approach the city of Errachidia. After lunch we'll continue our journey through the Ziz Valley to Erfoud till we get to Sahara Desert.Then we'll take a camel ride to a Berber camp in the middle of the Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes which are the highest sand dunes in North Africa. The camel trek takes about 1hr 30 min to the camp with tents for your night in the desert. The tents are well equipped with mattresses, blankets, and cushions. After dinner we will gather around the fire and enjoy the sound of traditional Berber drums under a starry sky.

itinerary.title: Sahara – Todra Gorge – Dades Valley
itinerary.description: The camel-man will wake you up early to enjoy a magnificent sunrise on the dunes then take a camel ride back to the hotel. After freshening up and breakfast we'll leave for Tinghir and the Todra Gorges finally, arrive in the Dades Valley where we will have dinner and spend the night.

itinerary.title: Dades Valley – Skoura – Ouarzazate – Ait Ben Haddou – Marrakech
itinerary.description: After breakfast we'll drive through the Dades Valley towards Kalaat Mgouna and Ouarzazate. The route through the Dades Valley, the way of the thousand Kasbahs, provides numerous photo opportunities. We'll visit the Roses valley and Skoura village, then continue to Ouarzazat( the Hollywood of Africa ). Lunch is at the famous Ait Ben Haddou kasbah, the largest Kasbah in Morocco. After discovering this UNESCO World Heritage site, our journey will go on through the majestic Tizi nTichka pass, reaching an altitude of (2260 m), over the High Atlas Mountains. We will stop to enjoy the impressive views, after we arrive Marrakech late afternoon and your 4 Days Tour Tangier To Marrakech Via Sahara Desert ends.

tangier-marrakech-8days.title: 8 Days Desert Tour From Tangier
tangier-marrakech-8days.subtitle: Complete Morocco Journey
tangier-marrakech-8days.overview: Experience an unforgettable 8-day Morocco tour from Tangier to Marrakech, exploring stunning landscapes, imperial cities, and the breathtaking Sahara Desert. Start in the blue city of Chefchaouen, wander through the Roman ruins of Volubilis, and discover the rich history of Fes. Journey through the Atlas Mountains to the magical Sahara Desert, where you'll ride camels and spend a night under the stars in a desert camp. Explore the dramatic Todra Gorges, the cinematic city of Ouarzazate, and the famous Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah before crossing the Tizi n'Tichka Pass to reach Marrakech. End your journey with a guided tour of Marrakech's vibrant medina, historical landmarks, and bustling souks. This well-planned Morocco itinerary is perfect for travelers seeking adventure, culture, and unforgettable experiences.
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
7 Nights in a hotel & Camp.
Camel ride in the Sahara desert ( a Camel Per person).
Dinners and Breakfasts.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Tangier – Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: Within The First Day Of Your 8 Days Tour From Tangier To Marrakech, We Will Meet You Where You Are And Drive Through The Rif Mountains Passing Through The City Of Tetoun To Enjoy The Views Of The Beautiful Mountains Until We Reach Chefchaouen, One Of The Impressive Villages At The Foot Of Rif Mountains. The Medina Of Chefchaouen Has A Spanish-Style Square Surrounded By Many Art And Craft Shops, Restaurants And Cafes On The Rooftop Where You Will Have Lunch. Then, Free Time To Explore This Interesting Village With Its White And Blue Color. The Night In A Moroccan Riad.

itinerary.title: Chefchaouen – Volubilis – Meknes – Fes
itinerary.description: After Your Breakfast In The Riad Our Trip Will Start Towards Volubilis Crossing Via Wazan And Other Villages Of Rif, In Volubilis We Will Discover The Roman Ruins With Its Historical Archaeological Site, After The Visit Of The Ruins We Will Take The Road To The City Of Meknes, Where We Will Have A Break For Lunch And Hang Around The Huge Historical Walls Of The Medina, Bab Mansour And Enjoy A Visit To The Sanctuary Of Moulay Ismail. After The Visit Of Meknes We Will Drive Directly To Fez Where We Will Spend The Night In Riad.

itinerary.title: Discovering Fes
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, We Will Begin To Discover The Oldest City In Morocco, Walking In Its Alleys. Our Visit Contains The Door Of The Royal Palace, The Jewish Headquarters, The First Mellah Built In Morocco During The Sixteenth Century. We Will Make Sure You Visit All Sites With Cultural And Historical Interest, Including The Famous Al Qaraouine University, The Oldest In The Region, The Tanneries, The Attarine Museum And The Mulay Idriss Mausoleum. After Lunch, You Can Enjoy A Wonderful Panoramic View Of The Entire Medina Of Fez.

itinerary.title: Fes – Ifrane – Midelt – Sahara Desert
itinerary.description: After Breakfast We Will Travel To Sahara Via Errachidia And Erfoud Through The Attractive Tiz Ntalghamt Pass And The Ziz Valley, Taking In Views Of The High Atlas Plateau, While Heading Landscape Changes To Reveal Desert Tracks As You Approach The Town Of Errachidia. Afterwards, You Will Travel Through The Exuberant Ziz Valley, Stopping To Enjoy Panoramic Views Along. While We Get To Sahara Desert Be Ready To Have A Lifetime Experience On Camel Trekking Between Sahara Dunes, Going Up And Down And Enjoying Sunset Till We Reach The Camp. Dinner Will Be Served Here With Berber Music Under A Starry Sky.

itinerary.title: Sahara – Todra Gorges – Dades Valley
itinerary.description: We Will Get Up Early To See The Spectacular Sunrise Over The Dunes Of The Sahara Before Making Our Way Back By Camels To Our Guest House For Breakfast And Take A Shower. Then, We Will Go Through The Mountains Of Saghro Till We Get Todra Gorges Which Considered The Highest And Narrowest In Morocco. Free Walking Inside In Short Time Through The Gorges Before We Drive To Dades Valley Where We Will Have The Night With Dinner And Breakfast.

itinerary.title: Dades Valley – Ouarzazate – Kasbah Ait Ben Haddou – Marrakech
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Will Leave Dades Valley Towards Kalaa M'gouna And Ouarzazate. The Route Through The Dades Valley Is The Way To The Thousand Kasbahs – Providing Numerous Opportunities To Take Some Of Your Best Photographic Shots Of The Trip. We Will Stop At Kasbah Ait Ben Haddou, The Largest Kasbah In Morocco, Used To Be One Of Main Stops Of Caravan Commercials During Along Journey From The Tomboukto To Marrakech. Now, The Kasbah Is One Of Unesco's Heritage Sites. After Walking Around The Kasbah We Cross High Atlas Mountains Full Of Panoramic Views And Attractive Berber Villages Along The Way Until We Reach Marrakech. Night In A Riad In The Medina.

itinerary.title: Visit The City Of Marrakech
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In The Riad, You Can Start Discovering Marrakech "The Red City Of Morocco". We Will Make Sure That You See The Most Important Sites With Historical And Cultural Interest, Such As The Majorelle Gardens, The Koutoubia Tower, The Saadian Tombs, The Bahia Palace. After Lunch At A Restaurant Near The Square, You Can Walk Through The Souks And See Hundreds Of Crafts. In The Afternoon You Will Have Free Time To Visit The Other Parts Of The City.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – Airport
itinerary.description: Airport Transfer.

tangier-marrakech-12days.title: 12 Days Morocco Tour From Tangier
tangier-marrakech-12days.subtitle: Ultimate Morocco Experience
tangier-marrakech-12days.overview: Experience the best of Morocco with our 12-day private tour from Tangier to Marrakech, blending cultural exploration, desert adventures, and historic sites. Your journey begins in the picturesque blue city of Chefchaouen, nestled in the Rif Mountains, before heading to the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis and the imperial city of Meknes. Discover the spiritual heart of Morocco in Fes, known for its UNESCO-listed medina and ancient Al Karaouine University. Explore the Sahara Desert with an unforgettable camel trek, and immerse yourself in Berber culture. Continue your adventure through the stunning Todra Gorges, the Dades Valley, and Ouarzazate, the Hollywood of Africa, before reaching Marrakech, where the iconic Jemaa el-Fnaa square and majestic Bahia Palace await. Optionally, take a day trip to Essaouira, the Jewel of the Atlantic. This Morocco desert tour offers a perfect mix of history, culture, and adventure!
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
11 Nights in a hotel & Camp.
Camel ride in the Sahara desert ( a Camel Per person).
Dinners and Breakfasts.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Tangier To Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: Within This Day We Will Drive Between A Series Of Mountains Called Rif Mountains With Its Green Land And Amazing Villages Till We Get To Chefchaouen, The Blue Pearl Of Morocco. Chefchaouen Medina Has A Spanish-Style Square Surrounded By Many Funky Arts And Crafts Stores, Roof-Top Restaurants And Cafes Where You Will Spend Your Night In A Nice Place To Enjoy The Breeze. The Night At A Typical Riad.

itinerary.title: Day To Explore Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: You Will Have A Free Day To Promenade Around And To Explore The Highlights Of The Blue City. Chefchaouen Or Chaouen Is A City In The North-West Of Morocco. It Is The Main Town Of The Province Of The Same Name, And Stands Out For Its Buildings In Blue Tones. Chefchaouen Or Chaouen, As It Is Often Called By The Moroccans, Is A Popular Tourist Destination Due To Its Proximity To Tangier And The Spanish Enclave Of Ceuta. The Name Refers To The Shape Of The Mountain Tops Above The City, Which Resemble The Two Horns Of A Goat. "Chef Chaouen" Derives From The Berber Word For Horns, Ichawen. Overnight At The Same Riad.

itinerary.title: Chefchaouen – Volubilis – Meknes – Fes
itinerary.description: In Our Third Day Of Our 10 Days Tour From Tangier To Marrakech, We Will Leave Blue City And Drive Towards Volubilis Via Ouazzane And Other Villages, In Volubilis We Will Discover The Roman Ruins And Learn About The Archaeological Site Of Morocco, After The Visit Of The Ruins We Will Shift Our Way To Meknes City Which Found In The 17 Century. After Lunch We Hang Around The Historical Walls Of The Medina By Visiting Bab Mansour And Moulay Ismail's Shrine. After The Visit Of Meknes We Will Drive Directly To Fez, Night Will Be At A Beautiful Riad.

itinerary.title: Fes Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, You Will Start Exploring Fes "The Spiritual City Of Morocco" With A Local Guide. You Will Spend The Whole Morning Exploring The Medina, Visiting Most Of The Sites With Cultural And Historical Interest – Including The Famous Al Karaouine Mosque And University (The Oldest In The World), The Tanneries And The Najjarine Fountain. After Lunch, We Will Drive Outside The Medina To See The Royal Palace Gate, Walk Through The Jewish Quarter "The Mellah", Then To Visit The Pottery Cooperative. Afternoon, We Will Drive To One Of The Fortresses To Experience An Amazing Panoramic View Of The Whole Medina Of Fes. Overnight At The Same Riad.

itinerary.title: Fes – Ifrane – Midelt – Ziz Valley – Erfoud – Sahara Desert
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We Drive To Merzouga Via Errachidia And Erfoud. Tizi N Talghamt Pass And The Ziz Gorges With The View Of The High Atlas Plateau, You'll See How The Scenery Changes To Reveal Hints Of The Desert As You Approach The City Of Errachidia. Afterwards, We Will Travel Along Ziz Valley Till We Reach Erfoud (Capital Of Fossils). Arrive At Merzouga On The Afternoon. And You'll Be Greeted With A Glass Of Tea When You Get Into Your Hotel.

itinerary.title: Discover Sahara Desert – Camel Trekking
