itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, You Can Take A Little Exploration Of The Local Area Before The Start Of Your Camel Ride; You Will Visit The Gnawa People – Originally From Mali, Senegal And Sudan – In Their Village Khamlia, Where You Will Learn About Their Music And Their Lifestyle. Today We Will Have A Traditional Berber Meal. You Will Have The Option To Visit The City Of Rissani – The Foundation Of The Alawi Dynasty – The Current Ruling Royal Family In Morocco. Rissani Is Surrounded By Around 300 Ksar And Has A Big Souk, Held Three Times A Week. Once Called Sijilmassa, This Was The Meeting Place For The Salt Caravans, Coming From Timbuktu In Mali, You'll Walk Through Its Famous Souk Where The Locals Of The Whole Area Come For Shopping. Then We Drive Back To The Village Of Merzouga From Where Camel Trekking Starts Guided By An Experienced Camel-Man To Explore What Is Hidden In The Middle Of The Highest Sand Dunes Till You Reach The Camp By Having Breaks For Taking Pictures And Enjoying Sahara Desert Sunset. Dinner Will Be Served At The Camp, Where You Will Spend The Night With A Spectacular Time By Drums Music Performance Played By Locals Under A Starry Sky.

itinerary.title: Sahara Desert – Todra Gorges – Dades Valley
itinerary.description: In This Day We Will Get To Know Merzouga Desert Sunrise Over The Dunes Of The Sahara. After Having Breakfast And Shower We Make Our Way Back Either By Camel Or 4×4 Option. Then We'll Drive Through Erfoud And Different Berber Villages Till We Get Todra Gorges, The Highest And Narrowest Gorges In Morocco, Where We Will Have Time For Walking And Enjoy Rock Formation. After, Having Lunch We Drive To Dades Valley Where We Spend The Night.

itinerary.title: Dades Valley – Boutaghrar – Skoura – Ouarzazate
itinerary.description: After Breakfast, We'll Drive Towards Kalaa M'gouna And Ouarzazate. The Route Through Dades Valley Is Named The Way Of Thousand Kasbahs – Providing Numerous Opportunities To Take Some Of Your Best Photographic Shots Of The Trip. Today We Will Have The Opportunity To Visit A Nomad Family In The Mountain Living In Caves, To Discover Another Style Of Life Different From The Other One In The Sahara Desert. We Will Stop At Kalaa Mgouna, "The Rose City", To Purchase The Rosewater, Which Will Make Your Linen Smell Good A Long Time After Your Trip Is Over. Continuing On To Skoura You'll Visit The Kasbah Ameridil, A Well-Preserved Kasbah In This Area. Lunch Will Be In A Traditional Moroccan Restaurant Overlooking The Beautiful Valley, To Ouarzazate, "The Hollywood Of Africa", Whose Geography And Beautiful Landscapes Have Attracted Many World Class Movie Producers. Here You May Choose To Visit The Studios, Containing Props Used In Movies Such As The Mummy, Gladiator And The Last Temptation Of Christ. Overnight Will Be At A Hotel.

itinerary.title: Ouarzazate – Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah – Marrakech
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, We'll Head To Marrakech, Visiting Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah, Which Is The Largest Kasbah In Morocco, Built By T-Hami El Glaoui, One Of The Last Berber Chieftains During The Beginning Of The 19th Century, It Used To Be One Of His Stops During His Long Travel From The Sahara To Marrakech. Now It Is One Of Unesco's World Heritage Sites. Your Journey Will Continue Through The Majestic Tizi N'tichka Pass (2260 M) Over The High Atlas Mountains To Marrakech. In Our Way You Will Have Chance To Explore The Way And The Process Of Making Argan Oil Which Existed Only In Morocco By The Berber Women In Their Cooperatives After We Get To Marrakech And Spend The Night At A Hotel\Riad.

itinerary.title: Marrakech City Tour
itinerary.description: After Breakfast We Spend Full Day Tour With A Local Guide To Discover Marrakech. The Stories Tell That City Was Inhabited By A Tribe On The Other Side Of The Atlas, With Large Supplies Of Dates And Bones Born A Palm. Called " The Red City " Because Of The Color Of Its Walls And Filled With Gardens, Watered By Underground Wells (Khettarat), Which Were Built By The Almoravids And Saharan Nomads In The Eleventh Century. We Will Visit Menara, The Kasbah, The Saadian Tombs, The Bahia Palace, The Koutoubia, Majorelle Gardens And Souks Are Some Of The Unavoidable Visits. A Unique Experience Will Be To Discover The Square " Djemaa El Fna " Where Life And Activity Of The City Is Concentrated: Dancers, Storytellers, Jugglers, Artisans, Merchants, And Snake Charmers. Overnight At The Same Hotel\Riad.

itinerary.title: Optional Day Trip To Essaouira
itinerary.description: After Breakfast In Your Riad, We Will Travel To The Coastal City Of Essaouira. Getting There After 2h30 And Start Exploring The City. You'll Visit The Skala Fortress; See Thuya Wood Carved By Artisans; Walk Through The Alleys Of The Medina And View Of Handicrafts. This "City Of The Wind" Attracts Surfers From All Over The World. Essaouira Knew Many Civilizations – Including The Portuguese Occupation, Which Affects Much Of Its Architecture – However, It Remains A Small Village With Much History. Because Of Its Size And Its Characteristic Blue Doors And Washed Walls, It Is Also Considered As Morocco's "Jewel Of The Atlantic". Lunch Will Be Cooked With A Moroccan Way – Fresh Fish. In The Afternoon You Will Travel Back To Marrakech. Overnight At Your Riad.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – Airport
itinerary.description: Transfer To The Airport.

casablanca-fes-3days.title: 3 Days Tour From Casablanca
casablanca-fes-3days.subtitle: Casablanca to Fes Journey
casablanca-fes-3days.overview: Embark on a 3-day tour from Casablanca to Fes, exploring Morocco’s rich culture and history. Visit Rabat, Meknes, and the ancient ruins of Volubilis, and discover the wonders of Fes, including its medina, Royal Palace, and the world’s oldest university. Enjoy scenic stops in Ifrane, the Cedar Forest, and Azrou. Choose from tailored itineraries for a truly unique experience!
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Comfortable transport with air conditioned 4×4 vehicle.
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Accommodation in hotel / riad.
Drop you off to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Casablanca- Rabat- Meknes( Bab Mansour And Volibilus) -Fes
itinerary.description: We Will Meet You In The Airport Or In Your Hotel In Casablanca. Then We Drive To Fes Passing By Rabat And Exploring Its Main Sceneries, After That We Drive To Explore Meknes. We Continue Our Way To Fes Where You'll Arrive In The Evening And Here You'll Overnight At Riad.

itinerary.title: Discover The Most Important Places Of Fes
itinerary.description: At The Morning You Will Visit The Medina (The Outdated City) And Its Side Streets.Also You Will Find Out The Jewish Quarter (The Mellah) And The Royal Palace (Yard), Which Is The Biggest One In The Country. In Addition To That, You Will See The Quaraouine Mosque Which Considered The First University In The World. After Lunch, In A Typical Moroccan Restaurant In The Medina,You'llhave Unforgettablepanoramic View Of The City. Overnight Will Be At The Same Riad.

itinerary.title: Fes – Ifrane – Ceder Forest – Azrou – Fes
itinerary.description: In This Day We Drive From Fes Towards Ifrane Which Seems As ( Swaziland Of Morocco), Then Passed By The Ceder Forest; Which Considered As The Largest Ceder Forest In The North Africa. Walking For A Moments In Order To See The Beauty Of Nature(Where You Will See Also A Barbarian Apes). After Lunch In One Of The Local Places In Azrou City. Then We Return Back To Fes Where Our Tour Ended.

casablanca-marrakech-7days.title: 7 Days Morocco Tour from Casablanca
casablanca-marrakech-7days.subtitle: Casablanca to Marrakech Adventure
casablanca-marrakech-7days.overview: Discover the beauty and diversity of Morocco on this 7-day journey from Casablanca to Marrakech. Explore Chefchaouen’s blue streets, the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis, and the historical treasures of Fes. Journey through the Middle Atlas to the mesmerizing Merzouga Desert for a camel trek and a night under the stars. Visit the dramatic Todra Gorge, the stunning Dades Valley, and the iconic Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah. End your adventure by crossing the High Atlas Mountains to vibrant Marrakech. A perfect blend of culture, history, and breathtaking landscapes awaits!
includes: Pick you up from your hotel.
Tour in 4×4, vehicle or minibus (with air-condition).
Experienced English speaking driver / guide.
Hotel overnight stays.
Camel ride(1 camel for each person) and 1 night in desert camp.

itinerary.title: Casablanca – Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: In this day we will meet you where you are either at the airport or hotel and drive to chefchaouen after we visit most attractions of casablanca. On the way we will make short stops to take some unique pictures of divers landscapes and different small villages till we get to the blue city. Overnight at a fantastic riad in the medina.

itinerary.title: Day to explore Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: You will have a free day to promenade around and to explore the highlights of the blue city. Overnight at the same riad.

itinerary.title: Chefchaouen – Volubilis – Meknes – Fes
itinerary.description: When you had breakfast in your riad, you will start travelling to fes via ouazzan and the roman site of volubilis. After a few of hours of driving, you will get to volubilis, the well preserved roman empire dating to 225 bc, where you will see the most attractive mosaics in morocco dating back to 3rd century. After that we travel to meknes, the ismaili capital. In meknes we see the fascinating gate bab mansour built by the sultan my ismail; the granary and the sahrij souani, used for irrigation and plantation. Then we continue via fes. Overnight at a fancy riad in the medina.

itinerary.title: Discovering Fes
itinerary.description: After having breakfast in your riad, you will start exploring fes the "the spiritual city of morocco". You will spend the whole morning exploring the medina, visiting most of the sites with cultural and historical interest – including the famous al karaouine mosque and university (the oldest in the world), the tanneries and the najjarine fountain. After lunch, we will drive outside the medina to see the royal palace gate, walk through the jewish quarter "the mellah", and then visit the pottery cooperative. In the afternoon, we will drive to one of the fortresses to experience an amazing panoramic view of the whole medina of fes. Overnight accommodation at the same riad.

itinerary.title: Fes – Ifrane – Azrou – Midelt – Erfoud – Merzouga Desert
itinerary.description: After breakfast, we will start travelling south to merzouga desert via midelt and errachidia. Your first stop will be at ifrane city, referred to as "the switzerland of morocco", and then to merzouga via midlet and the ziz valley. During this journey you'll experience glimpses of the middle atlas and higher atlas mountains. Stopping at the famous cedar forest – the largest one in morocco – where you will have the chance to see the barbarian monkys. On the way you'll notice how the scenery changes to reveal hints of the desert as you approach the er rachidia city. After lunch in midelt, trip going on along the spectacular ziz valley, stopping for panoramic views along the way. We will drive through berber villages to erfoud then to merzouga at the end of the day, you'll ride your camel to see the sunset in the middle of the highest sand dunes in morocco and spend the night there. Overnight at desert camp where you will have your dinner and sleep in a tent.( the best chance to see the moon and shining stars ), with traditional berber music played by locals.

itinerary.title: Sahara Desert – Todra Gorge – Dades Valley
itinerary.description: Your camel guide will wake you up early in the morning to watch what well may be the best sunrise in your life. Afterwards, you'll have a camel-trek back to your riad appreciating the unique beauty of the spectacular erg chebbi dunes – changing with the light as the day progresses. After breakfast and hot shower, we leave for tinghir and todra gorges "the highest, narrowest gorges in morocco". Here you'll have the opportunity to hike along it's valley. We'll drive through the dades valley, where you'll see the majestic sand castles and the amazing rock formations known as "monkey toes". Overnight will be in a riad or a hotel in the heart of the gorge.

itinerary.title: Dades Valley – Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah – Marrakech
itinerary.description: After breakfast, we'll drive through the dades valley towards kalaat mgouna and ouarzazate. The route through dades valley is named the way of thousand kasbahs – providing numerous opportunities to take some of your best photographic shots of the trip. We'll stop at kalaat mgouna, "the rose city", to purchase the rosewater, which will make your linen smell good a long time.then continue to ouarzazate, "the hollywood of africa". Lunch will be at the famous ait ben haddou kasbah, the largest kasbah in morocco. It is recognized by unesco as a world patrimony. It is famous as a backdrop for many films such as;'lawrence of arabia', 'gladiator'. Our journey will continue through the majestic tizi 'n' tichka pass (2260 m) over the high atlas mountains where you can stop to explore the process of making the argan oil at the women's cooperatives before arriving to marrakech, where the tour ends

casablanca-marrakech-15days.title: 15 Day Morocco Trip from Casablanca
casablanca-marrakech-15days.subtitle: Complete Morocco Discovery
casablanca-marrakech-15days.overview: Morocco is considered as the best destination so far around the world among the travelers, and that does not come in random as is a home of diversity, hospitality and safety. If you are looking to live and to discover all the aspects we have mentioned above that Morocco known by, we encourage you to book this 15 day tour starts from Casablanca and ends in Marrakech which covers the most visited places around the Kingdom; Rabat, Assilah, Tangier, Chefchaouen, Fes, Sahara Desert, Ait ben Hadou, Agadir, Essaouira, Marrakech and too many other interesting areas.
includes: Transportation in Ac and comfortable vehicle.
Fuel, tolls and any associated expenses.
Pick up from your hotel, Riad, airport or wherever you want.
English, French or Spanish driver / guide.
9 nights in BB (bed and breakfast) in Hotel/ Riad in Casablanca, Rabat, Tangier, Chefchaouen, Fes, Essaouira and Marrakech.
Night with half boarding (diner, bed and breakfast) in hotel/ Riad.
Night with half boarding (diner, bed and breakfast) in desert camp.
notIncluded: Diners in Casablanca, Rabat, Tangier, Chefchaouen, Fes, Essaouira and Marrakech.
Entrance fees to touristic Monuments; Kasbahs, Museums…
Anything not mentioned in the program.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Casablanca
itinerary.description: Welcome to Morocco! Upon arrival at Casablanca airport, your dedicated driver will greet you and transfer you to your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Casablanca – Rabat
itinerary.description: After breakfast, visit the iconic Hassan II Mosque, a masterpiece of Moroccan architecture and one of Casablanca's top landmarks. Then, head to Rabat, the imperial city and administrative capital of Morocco. Explore the Mechouar surrounding the Royal Palace, the historic Oudayas Kasbah, and the stunning Mausoleum of Mohammed V and Hassan II. Overnight stay in Rabat at a charming hotel or riad.

itinerary.title: Rabat – Asilah – Tangier
itinerary.description: After breakfast, travel to Tangier with a stop in the serene beach town of Asilah. Explore its artistic streets and coastline before continuing to Tangier. Discover the fascinating Hercules Caves, Cape Spartel, and the vibrant city of Tangier. Overnight stay in Tangier.

itinerary.title: Tangier – Rif Mountains – Chefchaouen
itinerary.description: Begin the day with a visit to the Hercules Caves and enjoy the captivating views of Tangier. Continue through the Rif Mountains to the charming blue city of Chefchaouen. Admire the unique architecture, whitewashed houses, and lush surroundings of this picturesque Berber town. Overnight stay in a riad or guesthouse in Chefchaouen.

itinerary.title: Chefchaouen – Volubilis – Meknes – Fes
itinerary.description: After breakfast, depart for Meknes, stopping first to explore the Roman ruins of Volubilis, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Continue to Meknes to visit the old medina, the Mausoleum of Moulay Ismail, the grand Bab Mansour Gate, and Lahdim Square. End your journey in Fes with an overnight stay in a riad.

itinerary.title: Guided Tour of Fes
itinerary.description: Spend the day exploring Fes, the oldest imperial city in Morocco. Visit the UNESCO-listed old medina, famous for its labyrinth of narrow streets, colorful souks, and historical landmarks. Highlights include the Bou Inania Madrasa, Al-Attarine Madrasa, Ennajarine Fountain, the Mausoleum of Moulay Idriss, and Al-Qarawiyyine University. Conclude with a panoramic view of the medina before visiting the modern district of Fes El-Jdid. Overnight in Fes.

itinerary.title: Fes – Ifrane – Middle Atlas – Midelt
itinerary.description: Journey through the Middle Atlas mountains, passing lush cedar forests and picturesque towns. Stop in Ifrane, known as "Morocco's Switzerland," and Azrou, a traditional Berber village. Continue to Midelt for an overnight stay in a kasbah or hotel.

itinerary.title: Midelt – Ziz Valley – Erfoud – Merzouga
itinerary.description: Travel to Merzouga, passing through the stunning Ziz Valley with its palm groves and lush landscapes. Stop in Erfoud, famous for its fossils, before heading to the edge of the majestic Erg Chebbi dunes. Enjoy a sunset over the dunes and settle into a desert hotel.

itinerary.title: Explore Merzouga & Overnight in the Desert
itinerary.description: Discover the region of Merzouga, beginning with a visit to a local Gnawa village to enjoy traditional music. Visit the nearby desert lake and explore the palm groves of Tafilalet. Afterward, visit Rissani, the birthplace of the Alaouite dynasty. In the evening, enjoy a camel ride at sunset and stay overnight in a traditional nomadic tent in the heart of the Erg Chebbi dunes.

itinerary.title: Merzouga – Todra Gorges – Ouarzazate
itinerary.description: Begin the day with a camel ride at sunrise before breakfast. Travel to the Todra Gorges, a stunning canyon with dramatic cliffs. Pass through the Valley of Roses and the famous "Road of 1,000 Kasbahs," where you'll see ancient fortresses and lush oases. Arrive in Ouarzazate for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Ouarzazate – Taroudant
itinerary.description: After breakfast, head to Taroudant via Taznakht and Taliouine, Morocco's saffron capital. If visiting during saffron harvest season, you'll meet Berber families in the fields. Arrive in Taroudant to explore its medina, ramparts, and local market. Overnight stay in Taroudant.

itinerary.title: Taroudant – Agadir – Essaouira
itinerary.description: Travel to the coastal city of Agadir, a popular resort destination. After lunch, continue along the scenic coastal road to Essaouira. Along the way, admire herds of goats climbing argan trees. Arrive in Essaouira in the late afternoon and settle into your riad.

itinerary.title: Essaouira – Marrakech
itinerary.description: Spend the morning exploring Essaouira, known as the "Jewel of the Atlantic." Visit its fishing port, Skala ramparts, Sidi Mohammed Ben Abdallah Museum, and vibrant souks. After lunch, depart for Marrakech. Overnight stay in a riad in Marrakech.

itinerary.title: Guided Tour of Marrakech
itinerary.description: Discover Marrakech, the "Red City." Highlights of the guided tour include the Bahia and Badi Palaces, Saadian Tombs, Menara Gardens, and Koutoubia Mosque. Visit the bustling Jemaa el-Fna square, famous for its storytellers, entertainers, and food stalls. Overnight in Marrakech.

itinerary.title: Marrakech – Casablanca Airport
itinerary.description: After breakfast, transfer to Casablanca airport for your departure, marking the end of your Discover Morocco Trips journey.
